WRITING.TITLE: [META] USA! USA! USA!
WRITING.TEXT: God, someone please claim America and let them be good
[m] Also, please tell me when the unit returns from deployment
The Republic of Texas approves the use of the 83rd Infantry Division. [m] tell me, same as maine
[m] Sucks for you, but they seem like good enough reasons
[m] Did they have a reason, or were you just forgotten?
[m] Is Mexico part of the NAA?
All the governments involved would be treated as equals, as is currently the case in the NAA.

The Prairie Party understand this concern, and does not wish to poison any talks that would do such a thing. However, they believe that, if anything, The United States and the Midwest should be reunited, if only two nations can come together.
Even though the current administration has no reasons to move towards independence, they believe that if it happens, the strong ties formed in the NAA will be vital in entering the Global Stage.

We wish to know what part of this you think unlikely? Is it simply that you think this wouldn't happen at this time, considering the conflict elsewhere, or do you simply believe that this would not have happened period?

WRITING.TITLE: [NEWS] Texan Independence Party Leadership
WRITING.TEXT: As with the Prairie Party, the Texan Independence Party has decided to hold a referendum to Discuss the future of the party. As the party is currently extremely small, they have called all available registered members to take part in a forum to discuss the future of the Party and it's organization. Throughout a week-long forum, it was decided to, much like the Prairie Party, to set up a system of delegates similar to the two major parties. The decision of a head of party was a different matter, with many of the assembled individuals clamoring for the position. In the end, James King, a former House representative in the Texas Government, and a member of the newly formed party, was chose for the experience he has in politics. Coupled with this role, and the currently limited membership of the party, he is currently expected to be the Presidential candidate if the party does not increase much in size between now and the next election.

WRITING.TITLE: [NEWS] The Prairie Party Leadership
WRITING.TEXT: The Prairie Party have met in Austin to discuss the future for their party and their leadership. The current delegates discussed many motions, such as the organization of their party and the selection process for Presidential candidates, to the Chair for their party. For the answers to the first two questions, they decided to not try and re-invent the wheel, and simply follow the examples of the Republican and Democratic Parties. As for the chair of the Party, The delegation decided upon Nathan Jones, a believer in The re-unification of Texas, The United States, and The Midwest, and a supporter of the NAA for the steps it takes to re-unite the United States with the Midwest, thus helping to return Texans to their roots.
That's why you gotta declare independence
